title: Ben Nevis
summary: Ben Nevis (/ˈnɛvɪs/ NEV-iss; Scottish Gaelic: Beinn Nibheis [pe(ɲ) ˈɲivɪʃ]) is the highest mountain in Scotland and the United Kingdom. The summit is 1,345 metres (4,413 ft)[1] above sea level and is the highest land in any direction for 459 miles (739 kilometres).[3][lower-alpha 1] Ben Nevis stands at the western end of the Grampian Mountains in the Highland region of Lochaber, close to the town of Fort William.
